title: Power - resistance of an electric stove burner

content.question: The four burners on an electric stovetop are connected in parallel to a <math alttext="240 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>240</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math> power supply. Each burner is dissipating <math alttext="2600 watts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>W</mtext></math> of power. What is the resistance of a single burner?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.4 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>
<math alttext="11 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>11</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>
<math alttext="22 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>22</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>
<math alttext="43 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>43</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="22 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>22</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
